7IrBNljG8a8m4nDDJe_r3g.text: Sometimes I despair of Trinity - there's such a lack of decent places in the area! The Mulberry Bush is my last resort at lunch time when I have no other options (of which there are not many). It's really between a two and three star to be honest, because it's mostly a miss. But the baked potatoes are really very good so that is worth a mention.   Avoid most of the hot food - it all tastes like some kind of curry. I remember I once had stovies and it just about blew my head off with spice. Blergh! Oh, but then there's the macaroni and cheese, which tastes of nothing at all (??).  Good: baked potatoes, carrot/banana cake and falafel baguette. Bad: most of everything else.

ytl6KxZoL5gzZsKybso4mQ.text: The fake book wallpaper is an apt analogy for the fake bacon and black pudding roll I just received. All the meat is precooked and lying on display, dehydrating for your pleasure. The black pudding was so hard it went in the bin. The 2 latte went down the sink. Foul ashtray tasting coffee. I Mulberry you goodbye.

wqKeCWwuuQ5w9y0RPd1Jxw.text: great place for a snack at lunch or breakfast Be sure to buy a baked potato as they are the best i have ever had! Nice and cheap as well as friendly staff. Takeaway or sit-in you decide! On Newhaven road on the opposite side of Ferry Road from the Forth.
